recipe_card: Croque Madame on Brioche 1 Rating
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"4 tablespoons salted butter, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup whole milk"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons Dijon mustard"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅛ teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg"},{"recipe_ingredients":"salt and ground black pepper to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons white vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 large eggs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 (1 inch) thick slices brioche bread"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 slices deli ham"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 slices Gruyere cheese"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon chopped fresh chives, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon smoked paprika"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 slices plum tomato"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Whisk in flour and cook for 1 minute. Whisk in milk and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Season with Dijon, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Cook until sauce coats the back of a spoon, about 3 to 5 minutes. Remove sauce from the heat."},{"recipe_directions":"Fill a large saucepan with 2 to 3 inches of water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low, pour in vinegar, and keep the water at a gentle simmer. Crack an egg into a small bowl then gently slip egg into the simmering water, holding the bowl just above the surface of water. Repeat with the remaining egg. Cook eggs until the whites are firm and the yolks have thickened but are not hard, 2 1/2 to 3 minutes. Remove the eggs from the water with a slotted spoon, dab on a kitchen towel to remove excess water, and place onto a warm plate."},{"recipe_directions":"Melt remaining butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add bread and toast in melted butter on both sides. Top bread slices liberally with warm sauce, then top with ham and Gruyere cheese. Place poached eggs on top."},{"recipe_directions":"Cover the pan with foil or a lid and turn off heat. Let stand until cheese has melted and sauce and eggs have set, about 5 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Serve immediately, spooning any leftover sauce on top of eggs. Season with salt and pepper and sprinkle with chives and paprika."}]

recipe_card: Grilled Cheese, Apple, and Thyme Sandwich 5 Ratings
recipe_name: Grilled Cheese, Apple, and Thyme Sandwich
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"3 teaspoons butter, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 slices cinnamon-raisin bread"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½  Granny Smith apple - peeled, cored, and thinly sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅔ cup shredded Gruyere cheese"},{"recipe_ingredients":"6 sprigs fresh thyme, leaves removed"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Spread butter on 1 side of each slice of bread; flip, so that buttered sides are facing down. Top 2 slices of bread with apple slices, 1/3 cup Gruyere cheese, and a sprinkle of thyme leaves. Place the other 2 slices of bread on top, buttered sides facing up."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat a large skillet over medium-low heat. Add sandwiches to the hot pan and cook until bread has toasted and cheese has slightly melted, 4 to 5 minutes. Flip carefully using a spatula, pressing down lightly. Cook sandwiches until golden brown and cheese has melted, 3 to 4 minutes more, watching and adjusting heat if necessary to keep bread from burning before cheese has melted."},{"recipe_directions":"Transfer sandwiches to a plate, slice in 1/2 diagonally, and serve immediately."}]

Line a baking sheet with foil and spray foil with cooking spray."},{"recipe_directions":"Stir 1 tablespoon mayonnaise, mustard, pepper, and cayenne together in a small bowl."},{"recipe_directions":"Slice chicken breast in half lengthwise, then slice each piece in half again. Align the thicker end of one piece of chicken with the thinner end of another, forming a consistent thickness that would fit into a hot dog bun. Repeat with remaining two pieces."},{"recipe_directions":"Transfer chicken to a plate and season chicken with kosher salt. Spread mayonnaise mixture over top and toss to coat."},{"recipe_directions":"Re-align chicken pieces and wrap each chicken \"dog\" with 2 slices bacon, making sure you don't wrap too tightly and that you tuck the ends of the bacon underneath the chicken. Place on the prepared baking sheet."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the center of the preheated oven until the bacon is browned and the chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 20 minutes. recipe_card: Sushi Burritos
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups cold cooked sushi rice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ tablespoons unseasoned rice vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon kosher salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 sheets toasted nori (dry seaweed)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons sriracha mayonnaise"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ small avocado, thinly sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  cucumber, cut into matchsticks"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup matchstick carrots"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons radish matchsticks"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ounce smoked salmon, thinly sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ounce cream cheese"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Place sushi rice in a medium bowl. Combine vinegar, sugar, and salt in a small saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Stir until sugar and salt have dissolved, about 1 minute. Pour vinegar mixture over sushi rice and mix to combine. Set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Place each nori sheet onto a piece of parchment paper on a clean work surface. Top each sheet with 1 cup sushi rice, pressing to create an even layer, leaving 1 inch exposed at the bottom of the sheet and 1/2 inch exposed on the sides and top. Spread 1 1/2 tablespoons mayonnaise lengthwise down the middle of the rice. Top each with 1/4 cup avocado slices, 1/4 cup cucumber, 2 tablespoons carrot, 1 tablespoon radish, 1/2 ounce smoked salmon slices, and 1/2 ounce cream cheese. Make sure all ingredients run down the length of the mayonnaise in the center of each burrito."},{"recipe_directions":"Wet fingers with a little bit of water and spread on the bottom of each nori sheet. Using parchment paper, tightly roll the bottom of each nori sheet up over salmon, cream cheese, and vegetables, and continue rolling until completely sealed. Use parchment paper to press and ensure roll is tight. Discard parchment paper and slice sushi burritos in half on a diagonal. Serve immediately."}]

recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 (6 ounce) beef top sirloin steaks"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups orange juice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup apple cider vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup Worcestershire sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ tablespoons steak seasoning (such as Fiesta Brand® Uncle Chris'), or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"freshly ground black pepper to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons olive oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"sea salt to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Gather all ingredients."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Place steaks side by side in large casserole dish. Add orange juice, cider vinegar, and Worcestershire sauce."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Marinate, uncovered, in the refrigerator for 45 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove casserole dish from refrigerator. Cover steaks with plastic wrap and let allow to come to room temperature, at least 15 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Place steaks on a clean work surface and generously rub with steak seasoning and black pepper."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Heat olive oil in a cast-iron skillet over high heat."},{"recipe_directions":"Cook steaks in the hot skillet until lightly browned on the bottom, 2 1/2 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Flip and cook until browned on the other side and red in the center, about 2 minutes more."},{"recipe_directions":"Transfer skillet with the steaks to the oven."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until steaks are firm and reddish-pink to lightly pink in the center, 8 to 10 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read from 130 degrees F (54 degrees C) to 140 degrees F (60 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove steaks from oven; season with salt. Let rest for 5 minutes before serving."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Enjoy!"},{"recipe_directions":"DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS"}]
